website_summaries.verdict: Built with a cushioned sole and reinforced seams, this bootie is perfect for schlepping around camp after a tough day’s hike.
pros: While camp booties are primarily meant to keep feet warm in a tent or hammock, the reinforced sole will hold up to quick walks around the campsite
Sized to accommodate feet of nearly all sizes
Toasty warm, with drawstrings that keep drafts out
cons: Sizing tends to run large, and improperly fit booties can impede comfort and warmth

customer_reviews.title: Warm slippers.  Wide.  I ordered a size down.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a ladies' size 9 and the size large was too big. They are wide, maybe because they are unisex. Exchanged for a medium and am keeping those. Photos are of the large size. They are really warm. Plus, they seem to have a better padded insole than some others I tried. No support, but a good pad to walk on. I like that they come up well over my ankle and keep it warm. They are a little bulky to walk around in, so I wear them mostly while watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: LA Gal

customer_reviews.title: -40o MN Winter Camping and Warm Toes
customer_reviews.text: I am a year round winter camper... in Minnesota. As you can imagine, nighttime hanging in a hammock in Northern Minnesota in February can be a little chilly. I used to use just wool socks, which did OK, but I would inevitably get chilly feed. These booties stopped that. With my heavy wool socks and these boots, my toes are toasty warm all night, even during a -40o night last winter. They are too hot for me for anything other than winter, but everyone is a little different. If you are looking for something to warm your feet, these will definitely do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Aegis Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Pinchy in the toe area and WIDE
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever noticed the shoes that circus clowns wear, these have a very similar shape. They are wider than any human foot I've ever seen, yet rather pinchy and flat at the toe end. They do feel much like "sleeping bags for your feet" but are not exceptionally warm, though warmish. The sole is quite thin, and should be used indoors on carpets only. Rather pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping bags for your feet
customer_reviews.text: Due to a neurological condition my feet turn into blocks of ice in the winter. So much so the only thing that brought some relief were thermal socks. That is, until I bought these. It's 18° here right now and I'm sitting next to a non-insulated wall with my Baffins on and no frostbitten feet. No thermal socks needed either. They're basically sleeping bags for your feet with a slightly harder, somewhat non-slip, but still very flexible bottom. These have been one of my most useful purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Waaay too small
customer_reviews.text: These looked like just the thing for me, so I read the reviews and saw that there was a trend of the sizing being on the small side. Because of this, I ordered XXXL. I wear a size 11 shoe, but when these came, they looked like they were made for a child's foot. I could not get my feet in them without bending my toes to shorten my foot. It's too bad because they seemed warm and well made. I guess if you have small feet they would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Rund (rund@tctc.com)

customer_reviews.title: Warm but opening way too small
customer_reviews.text: The boot is warm and breathable but the opening is super small. I had a hard time getting my foot in and out of the slipper. The part of the bootie below the ankle was large and roomy, a stark contrast to the overly small top. I wouldn't recommend these based upon how hard they were to get on and off. After all if the foot part of the boot is roomy and the opening is almost too small for the foot to go through that's a huge problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: These are huge and so very clumsy, twisting and turning. Swapped 1st pair for a smaller pair and still absolutely enormous! Their fit guide is off so I feel the fault is there. After sending back second pair I only received a portion of the money I paid! Very disappointed in this Seller. Do not recommend. If I paid over $30.00, I should receive my money back in full. They based my purchase from the first purchase not the second, therefore I only received a percentage of what I paid. This is their fault not mine but they kept my money anyway. Bad business ethics.
customer_reviews.author: C. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for mountain adventures
customer_reviews.text: I had almost bought these before but after reading mixed reviews, I decided not to purchase them. After being later recommended by a guide in preparation for a hut trip in Colorado, I purchased the Baffin Base Camp Booties and am incredibly happy with the purchase. I wore them in the hut, outside in the snow, and all around for a couple days. They kept my feet warm and dry. My guide also had his own pair that lasted several years without breaking down. If you'll looking for something to keep your feet warm during a mountain adventure, you'll be satisfied with these booties.
customer_reviews.author: Warner

customer_reviews.title: I love these booties!
customer_reviews.text: I love these booties! This is my second pair of Baffin booties. The first were the original and lasted a little over 3 years, but the soles finally wore out. I like these because they have a firmer sole and have a little more insulation than the original. I'm required to go outside to smoke in my apartment complex, which is fine in the summer but in the winter I need to bundle up. Ski pants, wool sweater, parka, and these booties! Sitting outside in 6°F weather and my feet and toes are fine just wearing these. I love these booties.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Quack!
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Baffin products. These camp booties are shaped wrong. They would fit a duck. They are flat near the toes. Meaning, there is practically no insulation over your toes, nor free air space inside the bootie. Your toes are what gets cold first and worst. They are otherwise well constructed. Everything but the toe area is well insulated, warm and fits well. Too bad the most important part is very poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Warmest slippers I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant buying these booties, as other reviewers mentioned that the tacky grips on the bottom made out of the words 'Polar Proven' wear down too quickly. I decided to give it a chance, and after a week and a half of constant wear, mine are still very much in tact, with no wear thus far. All I can say in answer to those that had problems is maybe they received a pair that shouldn't have made it through QA. Mine are great. I am very pleased with this purchase, as these booties have kept my feet warmer than any other slipper I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: The Mystifying Oracle

customer_reviews.title: Stitching failed within a month.
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving these a 1 star because they are extemely comfortable and beyond warm. The reason though is I have had them less than a month and the stitching has pulled away. For the price this should not happen. I have tried to find someone to contact about this but have had no luck. I live in Alaska and have many pairs of Baffin boots and love them. Never had a problem with Baffin until now.
customer_reviews.author: Morganflyfishing

customer_reviews.title: Quality has declined.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. The other two were great--only wore our because I wear them all day most days (I did need to add patches on the bottoms so I would not slip once the rough surface wore off, as most reviewers mention. Not a big deal. But this time the problem is the "neck" of the bootie that comes up my ankle is cut so narrow I can barely get it on. They are identical to my previous pair's soles, so I did not buy the wrong size. They are just scimping on the material. I may consider getting a size larger next time. Not good quality working
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issue
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are very comfortable and warm. I would recommend ordering a size bigger than you normally wear. The only issue is that I have only worn them 6-7 times and the one slipper has some stitching around the back upper edge, where you pull the slipper on, has separated and is fraying. In my opinion, they should have put a pull on ring there and sewn it a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, they deliver on warmth
customer_reviews.text: I used these boots on a Sierra Club Wilderness Travel Course snow hike in the Sierras. The first night we slept under the stars in zero degree weather. I wore these boots with a pair of wool socks in my sleeping bag and did not have a problem with the cold and my feet. The rest of me was a different story. Other people complained about the cold and their feet. I'm sold on these. They really keep your feet warm! Easy to use. Good quality. A little bulky to pack in your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Add to cart!  Checkout now.  ....I'm waiting.....  What? Cold feet?
customer_reviews.text: Do you ever have persistently cold feet in and around the house? Why tolerate it? Get these "sleeping bags for your feet". They are a little bit like moon landing boots. Due to the soles being houseshoe-like, I wouldn't walk over wet, icy or snowy surfaces in them much but they absolutely keep my feet toasty. The XX-Large are a little roomy for a mens size 11 US. They would fit a mens 12 perfectly. I have room for thick socks but you don't even need that. For those of you who sneak a lot, these boots don't clickety-clack when you walk on tile either. Light as a feather and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cybersavior

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Cold Feet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair for my husband for his birthday, his feet are always cold. He loved them so much, I bought a pair for myself. They are toasty warm, I only wish that they were made in the USA. I read the reviews and ordered a size that I thought would be long enough, they are but are so wide a could easily put two feet side by side:) I think if the engineering were perfected, nothing would top these slippers for warmth!
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: My feet are warm for the first time since August.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota its cold here in the winter, -26 the other day. I have tried fuzzy slippers, wool socks and slippers, nothing made my feet warm. Best i could do was bearable. I thought I could order some down slippers. I got them yesterday and put them on immediately. My feet were warm for the first time since August. Very warm and comfy. I don't know why I waited so long to get them.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Sprague

customer_reviews.title: well made & warm
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these around the house for a month I'm ready to evaluate these slippers. First of all they are very warm, which is what I wanted. They are holding up to normal wear indoors as well as daily runs for firewood out in the garage. They look huge but fit fairly snugly, more so if wearing socks. I wear a 9.5 4E if that helps. A good value.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schuessler

customer_reviews.title: Look Great, Fail to Do The Job....
customer_reviews.text: These looked like they would do the job, I have had camp booties before. They have pull cords at the top to keep warm air in etc. But after wearing them around the house three days I just cannot get around the fact that the JUST ARE NOT WARM. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: WARM!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots/slippers! I put them on when my feet were cold (I have bad circulation and live where it gets below freezing, so once they get cold they stay cold) and they warmed up! They’re great to wear around the house or laying around, I think I’ll peobably wear them a LOT this upcoming winter. Only took away a star because they do look kinda goofy and make your feet look huge. But that’s not a problem for just wearing around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: I doubt that I would be happy with these below freezing but I don’t do below ...
customer_reviews.text: These tthings are big! I mean they are goofy looking but they are warm. Warm is relative. We moved to Tucson seven years ago from San Jose California. When we moved here 70 degrees was suntan weather. We have two seasons in Tucson. Summer and February. Yesterday, Dec 13, it was 85 in the shade. At night, however, it gets cold. What’s cold? Hell, now when it gets down to 70 I get my down jacket out. At night, it gets cold enough for the Coyotes to start howling. I’m talking low 40’s. These things are still toasty. I doubt that I would be happy with these below freezing but I don’t do below freezing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Warm even in sub-zero temps, durable, cheap, fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for winter camping. These things have kept my feet warm camping in sub zero temperatures on a couple of occasions. I actually dread leaving their warmth and putting my winter boots on in the mornings. I suppose one argue it would be nice to have a little more traction on packed snow and ice, but they are fantastic for the price, and comparable in warmth to real down booties (from the likes of Feathered Friends).
customer_reviews.author: Shane Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for camping!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love. This has proven to be a great pair of down / camp slippers. Despite being a bit bulkier than alternatives, they definitely earn a spot in my pack for all future camping and backpacking adventures. After a day of hiking, being able to put these on and wear them for the rest of the evening around camp is absolutely perfect. I appreciate the "harder" sole (vs. a softer slipper) to walk around and even venture into the woods when, ahem, nature calls.
customer_reviews.author: CR Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I Wear a 8.5 Womens and these fit Well.
customer_reviews.text: Very warm; just in time for the severe cold in the east. I do wear them outside but only on dry pavement to and from the mailbox; thus minimizing wear & tear & water absorption. These I found slightly large but that allows me to wear socks with them; either thin athletic socks to assist in moisture wicking from my feet or thicker synthetic or wool if I need more warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great if you hardly ever wear them.
customer_reviews.text: In less than 2 months both of mine starting falling apart around the ankles. I wore them after work and on weekends around the house. When they were new they were like sleeping bags for your feet. They were exactly what I was looking for. It takes such an unbelievably minute amount of effort to properly stitch the materials involved so I'll just chalk it up to sweatshop conditions. The two pair I purchased as gifts are holding up better, but the seams are still splitting apart. I can't see them lasting into 2020 and they won't even see use again until November or later. Not recommended unless you plan on hardly ever wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: crapback

customer_reviews.title: Women's 12 B order XXL
customer_reviews.text: I'm a women's size 12 B. I ordered XXL and would recommend that sizing. Definitely don't go smaller. My toes touch the end of the shoes (although the heel slip with the instep strap tightened). If your feet are longer than women's 12, I would order up. The uppers feel delightful and almost silky on the feet. There's no support in the insole. I added a pair of Ugg's women's size 12 B inserts and made these slippers perfect. I don't wear them with socks. They are wide, but that's to be expected. You can tighten them across the instep using the strap. Very comfy. Not too hot, but keep the feet warm.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Canyon Girl

customer_reviews.title: Keep your feet warm!
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are the slippers to end all slippers. I like to keep the heating bill down during the winter, so I was looking for slippers that would keep my very cold feet warm even when I didn't turn the heat on. These do the trick for sure! They are so warm, so puffy, and they keep my feet from cramping up in the cold. Plus, my ankles stay toasty as well. My only critique is that the foam in the foot bed does compress fairly quickly, however that was not an issue for me as I only wear these around the house. The bottoms are fine for an occasional take-the-trash-out trip, but they really aren't meant for the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Such a great value
customer_reviews.text: They run a tad small in the upper part where your shin is, which makes them difficult to put on. However, I like that there's not a lot of space around that area, to keep the warmth in. And, boy, are they warm! I used them once out climbing and my feet were sweating in them, without socks on. Save yourself some money and buy these synthetic down boots, instead of a real down for way more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you camp or backpack, you do not know ...
customer_reviews.text: If you camp or backpack, you do not know luxury unless you have camp booties. Go from the sleeping bag to outside to answer the call of nature, and back in without strapping cold boots on. Step on sticks with no problem. Do you feet a favor- buy these, or any other camp bootie.
customer_reviews.author: Brahma

customer_reviews.title: Toasty and warm!
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are great. They just arrived today, but I can already tell that my feet and toes are going to be happy campers for the rest of this winter. I ordered them because I needed something warm to wear around the house, and I'm pretty sure that they will live up to that expectation. I wear a women's size 12, so I wasn't sure what size to purchase. I ordered an XXL and they fit just fine. There's wiggle room for some socks, too.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Ballema

customer_reviews.title: warm and mostly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet warm this winter. The sole shows no sign of wear and is heavy nylon. The soles have enough insulation -- obviously the sole can't be puffy like the top, but it's insulated. Of course any puffy slippers feel a bit sloppy, but that's the price of keeping your feet warm. The strap over the front of the ankle was not useful to me and may have put some pressure on the top of my feet. Inside, the edges of the soles are not finished smoothly, though this only matters when I wear them without socks, and I would not generally do that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight Booties
customer_reviews.text: These booties came today and went right on and they are better than I imagined. I suffer from peripheral neuropathy and just socks or even just a bed sheet can be uncomfortable. I put these on and the quilted area is so light it almost feels as if the fabric is lifting away from my feet. I have a big smile right now with warm comfortable feet ! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Robert Broun

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to wear inside my RV during the winter. They have a lot of padding inside. I am a true women's size 8 (Keen, Brooks, Oboz, Hoka) and the MED fit perfectly. They are basically super warm slippers for lounging. They are not pretty but warm feet are more important to me than looks.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: I do not like wearing shoes or slippers in the house
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and comfy. I do not like wearing shoes or slippers in the house. These are perfect as they feel like you are barefoot, yet your feet are warm. The stitching at the cuff did come out on one slipper and a shoe repair shop easily fixed it for a modest price. I could have done it myself, however, my sewing machine is currently in storage.
customer_reviews.author: SMcLeod

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing, too small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these that I loved and decided to replace them. Paid sixty dollars, got the same size as the pair I wore originally, only for them to be way too small. The sizes are inconsistent and not as advertised, so now I've wasted sixty dollars for something I can't wear.
customer_reviews.author: ts00

customer_reviews.title: So very warm
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my dad, who had polio as a youth and therefore has poor circulation in one leg. His feet are always cold. Well, not anymore. He loves these boots. He says his feet are warm all day. I wish I had found these twenty years ago for him. He is undoubtedly your most satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: Carole Maxson

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent so far. Much warmer and comfortable than my REI Down Booties which I have owned 3 pairs over the last 8 years since I used to work there. The fuzzy footbed is a really nice touch and definitely adds to the warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves these. She always complained about having cold ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves these. She always complained about having cold feet so I bought her these, and now they almost get too warm! Made with artificial down, so little strands of polyester poke out from the fabric, which is its only drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Just what I was looking for. I have an unheated house in GA, USA and wanted something for when in gets between 30-15 degrees F. These fit great and I haven't even been cinching them up -- but they still stay on my feet! Very pretty and seem to last well. Definitely big and fluffy -- you may feel like you have elephant feet -- but they will be really warm feet. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Passionplays

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, warm, runs large - unisex sizing
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, warm, very comfy. Very wide. The pair I purchased were too big for me but fit my daughter perfectly so we are keeping them. Just be sure NOT to wear them on any wet or damp! I SO wish they made these with a sole like the Eddie Bauer Camp Bootie! That would be the ideal camp slipper/bootie for me! Baffin, if in the future you remake these with a good sole for outside, please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Christine R. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: I am always complaining of frozen toes and these are sleeping bag material booties for your feet. I absolutely love these big comfy goofy looking slippers. I have a pair at my boyfriends house and at home. I wear a size 12 wide and they are extremely comfortable. GET THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Navia

customer_reviews.title: Down Booties
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of these booties is GREAT for the price! They are for INDOOR use. The sole is clearly not intended to be worn outdoors. I would suggest buying them at least 1-2 sizes larger than you street shoe as the toe compartment is small.
customer_reviews.author: rohe

customer_reviews.title: Baffin Base Camp Insulated Bootie, Black XLG
customer_reviews.text: I wear between a Womens' 10.5 or 11 depending on the shoe and these had plenty of room left over... like two inches in the heel and one in the toe but I could still walk just fine. (The boots snug to your ankle.)These are like walking in floofy pillows and are nice and warm. I have down boots and uggs as well as slipper sock boots.... so far these are most comfortable and don't slip, yet! By the way I live in the Great White North and does it ever get cold along the floors so even sitting and watching TV or in the kitchen you and need warm feet these cushion-ey (sp) babies do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Bear's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Insulated Slipper-Book
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled that these boots were re-introduced so I could get a new pair. I wore the ones I had around the house for two years. I uses a cushion insole with them for an extra cushy feeling. Because I have some peripheral neuropathy in my feet, they always feel cold. These boots keep me comfortable year round. The previous pair got a heavy amount of use which is my testimony to their sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth Be Told......

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The booties arrived in just a few days. They fit my size 12 feet (XXL booties). I read other reviews noting that the booties ran small, so I ordered a size larger than I might have otherwise. I lost my other pair of REI booties, so these are replacements. We go snow camping, so I will update after our trip this year. If they work, I will upgrade to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: j ARCHITECT

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: These keep hubby's feet cozy and warm! He even sleeps in them in the winter because his diabetic feet get soooo cold. They're very lightweight. The only issue, and it's a tiny matter, is the drawstring at the back of the leg. It seems to catch on everything! Other than that, these slippers are awesome and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: I N D O O R  U S E  O  N L Y!!!
customer_reviews.text: They make it sound like you can wear these on a HIKE or an excursion but they are I N D O O R slippers ONLY!! Besides that, they are WARM and WONDERFUL!! Keep my feet TOASTY! They should change their ads to reflect the fact that they are for I N D O O R U S E O N L Y!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Love these wacky slippers
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable and they keep my feet warm. They keep my ankles warm too, which is awesome! They don't fit snugly, but that is as it should be! They are a break for my feet after a long day in shoes.
customer_reviews.author: TLC4ALL

customer_reviews.title: Product quality has fallen since previous purchase years ago
customer_reviews.text: The "non-skid" sole has nearly worn off within a month, whereas the ones my wife bought for herself many years ago are still holding up. Very poorly constructed. The first pair she ordered for me ripped along the rear seam at the ankle within days. The replacement pair is still holding together but the quality is far inferior to the same brand she purchased more than 10 years ago. (Those are still in great shape!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SOLE WEARS OUT
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the shoe (sole) is made of thin cloth and wears out with in 2 months leaving holes in sole material. I loved the over all boot, but had to throw them away because they were unusable.
customer_reviews.author: stanley e brown

customer_reviews.title: ugly and not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Updating: These fell apart after a year and a half, not sturdy Original: these are sturdier upgrade from Baffin's "cush" booty (which lasted me less than a year). They are very wide and very ugly, but the length is good (I wear a 14). They are built the way North Face used to construct their non-rubber booties (which lasted me almost eight years), so I'm hopeful these Baffins give me at least a couple years. I've had them for a couple months now.
customer_reviews.author: buteogallicious

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last more than 3 uses!
customer_reviews.text: The tree on the bottom wire off after just 3 wears around my house, very disappointed. Been slipping all over the place. Very large and baggy but that’s what I was looking for. Very warm. Feet will sweat! The pull cords are not elastic and are very uncomfortable to tighten. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: arianna peluffo

customer_reviews.title: Little clouds on my feet.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. I only use them in my camper bed so that they don't get dirty. They keep my feet warm on even the coldest nights. They fit really loose so it feels like I'm foot naked and unrestricted. They're very lightweight too like little clouds on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Rashika

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting it to hold it's form like the picture but the sizing was too wide and ...
customer_reviews.text: The photo is misleading. I was expecting it to hold it's form like the picture but the sizing was too wide and flimsy. In my opinion the sole is too soft to wear outdoors. But they do keep your feet warm if thats what you're looking for
customer_reviews.author: Sam kan

customer_reviews.title: If you want warm toes buy these baffins!
customer_reviews.text: They are kind of oversized, but i put my orthotic in them and thick socks. My feet are not even a little bit cold! Seem wide but its ok, they are houseshoes! I would buy again when these wear out. Great price too sonas to not have cold toes! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm
customer_reviews.text: Husband has diabetes therefore suffers with very cold feet. He absolutely loves the booties and says they keep his feet nice and toasty. They are a little odd in the sense that there doesn't appear to have a distinct right and left boot; but they are warm and this is what matters to us.
customer_reviews.author: Sponkey Monkey

customer_reviews.title: I feel like a fool walking around in them
customer_reviews.text: I feel like a fool walking around in them, but they are one of the best things I've ever bought myself! After a long day outside in under freezing temps, I pull these on, and within an hour, I'm toasty warm again. For someone that's developed a serious sensitivity to cold, I appreciate how quickly I can recover.
customer_reviews.author: L. Moor

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these slippers for their comfort, there is nothing like them. I wear them all the time at home. My only complaint is they should be more durable. I replace them about every six months. I've gone a year but by then the inside fleece is threadbare, the antislip on the bottom is completely worn off and the seems start to rip.
customer_reviews.author: clevelandblue

customer_reviews.title: good fit and I wear and women's DD
customer_reviews.text: Warm, good fit and I wear and women's DD. Keeps your feet warm. When dry, I even wear them out at night to walk the dog on the concrete driveway in the winter and my feet stay toasty warm, with no socks on. Not for wearing on damp surfaces, though. The tread marking on the bottoms will come off. Love them in the house. I even have a pair that I sometimes wear to bed. My feet get cold and they are much better than socks.
customer_reviews.author: Deb H

customer_reviews.title: Help make the best of a drafty farmhouse!
customer_reviews.text: Warm and comfortable once I get them on. They have two provisions for tightening but I struggle to get my foot (which fits fine once in there) through the ankle section and certainly don't need the 'adjusters'. The box proudly announces Canadian design but they are actually made in China, maybe people have small ankles there?
customer_reviews.author: Fire Escape

customer_reviews.title: Definitely will keep feet warm.
customer_reviews.text: Returning for a refund with much disappointment. The body of these slippers are insulated very well. Definitely appear to be what would keep feet and ankles warm in a cold drafty area. These fit me such that I felt as if I had on clown or space boots. Pictures attached.
customer_reviews.author: eieio

customer_reviews.title: So pleased I found these!  Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Well, as I write this I just had to kick them off as my feet were getting too warm. That is a problem I can live with. I've only had the problem of horribly cold feet for about three years now. It is extremely unpleasant. I've tried multiple things to help. FINALLY something that works for me. Very happy. As others have said, not for outdoor use. But I am totally OK with changing out of them when I have to take the dog out.
customer_reviews.author: Zoomball2

customer_reviews.title: Great Winter Lounging Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Not for even moist outdoor wear. The heel will get wet first, followed by the middle. However, these are the warmest indoor slippers I've ever worn. No are h support, not for anything other than lounging at home. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet toasty warm
customer_reviews.text: Loved these booties! The first time I used them was for a mushing expedition in interior Alaska, and they kept my feet nice and toasty warm around the cabin at night. I didn't spend too much time walking outside in them, just a little bit here and there. Don't think they'd keep your feet warm outside, but then again they're made for use indoors, so.... Used them again last week while camping in Northern California. It was somewhat cold at night and I was happy I brought my booties! They were almost a little too warm to wear all night in the tent, but better too warm than too cold!
customer_reviews.author: MSN

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm
customer_reviews.text: I wear these in bed. I have a spinal cord injury that has left me with icy feet that have a tendency to get pressure sores. I saw these online here and since Amazon takes returns I tried them out. They not only keep my feet warm they provide padding to my vulnerable heels. I can imagine they would feel wonderful after hiking in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Turnbough

customer_reviews.title: Should be recalled as defective!
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my husband as presents. These boots are warm and comfortable. Everything he wanted, except that the tread was polished smooth in less than a week wearing in the house. He slipped on a wooden floor and fell against the wall, like he was on ice. The sole is of very shoddy materials and the product should be recalled as defective. Too bad, because he really like them otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mel A

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use backpacking in cold weather to walk around base camp. I intend on wearing them in my sleeping bag, as my feet get cold. They weigh about 4 oz each. I intend on reinforcing the bottoms with plasti dip, to give them more waterproofness so I can walk around camp. I've been wearing them around the house. They are super comfortable and super warm. I wear a size 8.5 women's and I have narrow feet. Based on other reviewers, I bought a large. It is the right length, but a bit wide.
customer_reviews.author: NatureGal

customer_reviews.title: Warm but Cheap - Returned for Refund
customer_reviews.text: First pair delivered were missing a fastener. They were quickly replace (thank you) by a pair that quickly tore on the collar that goes around the top of the bootie. The collar separated at the cheap stitching. I tore this collar off, and continue to wear the booties, which are otherwise very warm. Update: the sole has worn through on these very cheap booties. Cannot recommend, would not buy again. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: LarryM

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I bought them for an 8 day camping ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I bought them for an 8 day camping trip, but opted to use them more on the flights to and from my location. These are fantastic. I wore them on the plane and in the hotel only. They were a bit hard to put on, because the opening isn't very large, at the top, but once on the foot, there was lots of room to wiggle my toes. My arch is high, so I need a wide opening to put on boots. These are well made, and warm and they pack up easily. I am taking these on every flight I have. Soooo comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie S

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Perfect warmth for winter nights. It seems the soles wear faster than other booties, so ordered another pair. The first pair did not quite last one season, but they were worn continuously in the house and never outside.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Girlfriend Getting Cold Feet?  Be a hero!
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has the most amazingly cold feet. I purchased these for her and she absolutely loves them. I plan to purchase a couple more pairs of them for her. They pack down nice and small and are very portable. They work as well in the house as out camping.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to warm your feet!
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other reviews said: buy a size larger than you normally would, I did and it fits perfect even with larger socks. The rubber grip words on the bottom wore off in about 4 hours, so I walk carefully in them. The black nylon top is already pulling away on one foot....But oh are they toasty warm and that's what I needed. My ankles and feet were freezing while working in my basement office. Now they are toasty warm and I am much more comfortable and can work longer. As long as they don't fall apart, they are awesome and great for anyone who wants warmer feet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my feet nice and warm through the winter months
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my feet nice and warm through the winter months. The only drawback is that when I take the dogs out to do their business and the winter snow is starting to melt, the soles are not waterproof. Great product and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more cold feet when camping
customer_reviews.text: Took these camping in January. The temps dropped to low teens. I am pleased to report that these kept my feet warm even with me in a hammock. I honestly don't think I could have done it without these. They are comfy, roomy enough to let you wear a pair of socks in them. Very warm and pleased customer
customer_reviews.author: KayBee

customer_reviews.title: Feel free to click the helpful review button
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 11 shoe, got the XXL booties (size 11/12 by chart). Perfect fit, with a little extra toe room, so prob would fit a 12 also. Toasty warm for indoors, sole is a little on the flimsy side, would not expect them to last outdoors. I wanted a slipper to keep my feet warm indoors and thats what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Size 10 is a very tight fit and not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The Baffin base camp listed as fitting men's size 10 are really difficult to put on for this size. All tightners must be loose and still a stretch to get on. If a 9.5 it would be much more possible.
customer_reviews.author: UT8K

customer_reviews.title: toasty feet!
customer_reviews.text: I got them for my girlfriend, since she just wore down her other slippers. I have a pair of Sierra Design slippers but they were really expensive compared to these. After seeing her with these though, I think I might get a pair of them for myself as well. The only thing that I didn't expect is for the sole to be as hard as it was. It's great for walking around in, but not very comfortable curled up under a throw blanket on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: These helped keep my feet warm during our last cold ...
customer_reviews.text: These helped keep my feet warm during our last cold spell. Can't wait until next week we are camping and I want to see how well they work all night in the cold. I was able to wear these out on our deck when the temps were close to 0-5 degrees, and they kept my feet warm.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Toasty around the house.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for winter camping, but i'm afraid i'm going to wear them out just around the house. Good grip on the bottom. When packing, the sole doesn't compress, but everything falls flat on top of it. It will take up a lot more room than I thought in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: James Parr

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Cold Weather Climates!
customer_reviews.text: If I could sleep in these, I would. Where I live, temps dip down into the teens overnight. I am able to wear these all day comfortably, although I personally limit them to indoor use only. I like that they insulate my feet without making them sweaty. They fit a bit snug at first, but after a day or two wearing them, they stretched out just enough to fit my feet perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have neuropathy in my feet. When they get cold it is very painful. These slippers keep my feet toasty warm! They are kinda clunky looking and are on the pricier side but are worth every penny! I highly recommend to anyone wanting warm feet!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Boots for the trail
customer_reviews.text: These were bought for a backpacking trip on the Appalachian trail beginning in Maine and going to Georgia. Northern temps are very cold right now so I will wear these boots at night. Although packing ultralight I am making allowance for the weight just to keep warm in my sleeping bag. When placed in Ziploc bags they compress down enough to fit well in my sleeping bag. The ties are great too for snugness.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits great and very warm
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't feel too snug. Keeps body heat in, don't need socks. Adjustable straps are great. I've had other Baffin's, but this is the best one.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Constructed
customer_reviews.text: In just one week of wearing these around the house during the evening, the top layer of nylon is ripping out of the boot. That's putting them on less than 7 times before they ripped! It's too bad, because they are very warm. Into the trash where they belong!
customer_reviews.author: Brian02125

customer_reviews.title: Awesome booties.
customer_reviews.text: Great booties. Have taken them in 4 backpacking trips with temps below 30 and they kept my feet so toasty I had to take them out in the middle of the night. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Oyordone

customer_reviews.title: Size and fit
customer_reviews.text: I wear male size 10 1/2 shoe. Ordered XX-Large. I wouldn’t order anything smaller. Bootie is about 1/2” longer than foot. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: silversmith

customer_reviews.title: Warm Bootie
customer_reviews.text: Love these booties! I'm a 10 1/2 size shoe. I use them in my house every day during the winter to keep my feet toasty warm. I added a foam shoe insert to mine to give me a bit extra insulation from the cold floor and snug up the bootie a bit. I have had these for about 3 years and have had no trouble with them. I like them better than a friend's down booties because mine stand tall and keep their shape and do not squish down around my ankle with use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Willingham

customer_reviews.title: That being said they are really like sleeping bags for your feet and are great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to wear while relaxing in my recliner. Ordered them a little larger than I would have for walking around the house. That being said they are really like sleeping bags for your feet and are great! They are really warm, soft and comfy. I would order again in a heart beat!!! The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars, was because one of them didn't come with the elastic drawstring clamp. I ordered one from another company and installed it in 2 minutes and am happy again!
customer_reviews.author: john w. thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, but I leave on an elk hunt tomorrow and will update when I return. I'm back and these booties were great. It was 7 degrees in the mountains and they kept my feet warm. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Helton Jolly

customer_reviews.title: leave room for air
customer_reviews.text: One thing this kind of insulation needs is to stay fluffy. I size to probably a medium and bought XL. Sure they look like Minnie Mouse shoes, but they're warm. And they stay fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: My feet are thanking me!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn The North Face 500 booties completely out over several years, but they're no longer available. So, I took a chance on these and absolutely love them. I wear a 9.5 and ordered the XL. They fit me nicely, but I suspect they would be tight for someone with a larger foot. For me, they're super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kenwick

customer_reviews.title: Keeps feet warm
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have become a necessity. Being a diabetic with poor circlation in my feet; keeping my feet warm in the past was impossible with regular shoes or house-shoes. Finally my feet are warm at home (outdoors, keeping active kept my feet tolerably warm but inside they were very uncomfortable.) I ordered a full size larger than i normally wear so the shoes fit comfortably. I haven't used them outside at all but the look to be a great benefit when camping where regular shoes could damage the "floor" in tents.
customer_reviews.author: Inksew

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: I loved these! I was in the eastern sierras in late October and I was freezing due to a poor sleeping pad a bag. These saved my life by keeping my feet warm at night! There light and warm and I was so glad I had them as the temperature was dropping to 15 degrees at night but my feet stayed warm!
customer_reviews.author: Tim peterson

customer_reviews.title: A MIRACLE! KEEP YOUR FEET TOASTY WARM!
customer_reviews.text: These are a MIRACLE. Keep Mom's continually Freezing Feet toasty warm. She even sleeps in them. But dont wear them outside, they are not made for that
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Warm but a sloppy fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these booties to keep my feet warm in bed. They certainly do a good job of that. They feel comfortable and, my feet don't have any tendency to sweat in them. However the fit is clumsey enough that I don't even wear them while walking around in the house. And the construction doesn't look very durable either. So, if you want keep your feet warm while watching TV or laying in bed, these will do a good job. But I wouldn't recommend trying to wear them outside.
customer_reviews.author: Old Walker

customer_reviews.title: Baffin Base Camp Slipper
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair I think I've purchased in the last few years, I love this for around the house in the winter they are really warm and comfortable! The only negative thing I can say is that the soles don't last long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Keeping warm in Ely
customer_reviews.text: I sent these to my brother and sister-in-law who live in Ely, Minnesota. My brother said his feet feel warm! I bought merlot for sister-in-law and black for my brother. They were thrilled to get them. It gets awfully cold up there, and they heat with wood and a floor heater. My brother likes that they come up to cover his ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Cozy, Perfect for inside house
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other reviews I bought these boots to keep my feet warm in the house. I work at home sometimes and my home office sometimes makes my feet cold. I considered a space heater but this is a MUCH better option. They are cushiony and so warm. Plus I added some of those ski boot stick on heat pads under my socks. Now the boots are SUPERB! These boots are excellent. But they are not for outside.
customer_reviews.author: T and P Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Greatest insulated bootie on the planet!
customer_reviews.text: These are everything you want in a warm insulated bootie. Feels great, looks great, AND it really keeps your feet toasty. I use these at night, after a hard day's work, and are just what I need to feel comfy. You will also, when you try them on. I suggest you buy them one size up from your usual shoe size, they run a little small in size. The bottoms are great for inside mostly, with just enough of a sole to use if you have to run outside for something. I must confess I ware them to bed most of the time in the winter. They are that comfortable and overall soft.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kent

product_meta.title: Baffin Base Camp Slipper
product_meta.description: Twenty-five years ago Baffin Footwear began manufacturing insulated and non-insulated footwear products. While traditional molded boots are suitable for some conditions, they are not ideal for cold temperatures. Baffin combines leading molding technology with a foam-based inner boot system, which creates a hybrid style of high-performance footwear. This equates to more warmth, better fit, and superior comfort. Baffin boots are different than most shoes and work boots because the sole and midsole are molded to the base in one continuous process. The sole itself is a marvel of modern engineering because it is made up of several advanced thermo-set polymers that are combined together to achieve the right balance of warmth, protection, low weight and grip. Baffin is dedicated to offering boots with functionality and fashion, while still maintaining their legendary performance.
feature_bullets: Insulated slipper-bootie featuring dual bungee adjustability for added warmth
